alert.note: Alert for Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 20 at 2:40PM MST until February 23 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Localized higher amounts possible above 7500 feet. East winds gusting up to 25 to 35 mph may produce areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Southwest Carbon County and Upper North Platte River Basin, including the cities of Baggs, Saratoga, and Encampment. * WHEN...From 2 PM Tuesday to 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in 10 minutes or less.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
